text: Un délice ce restaurant ! Les plats qui sont proposés sont vraiments bons. J'y retournerai volontier quand j'aurai du temps.  Et oui en effet, si tu veux manger la bas il faut avoir du temps. Je n'ai mis que 3 étoiles car on a bien attendu 30 à 40 minutes avant d'être servie et avant qu'on prenne nos commandes on a du attendre 15 minutes. C'est un peu trop long surtout si on a faim !   Le lieu est vraiment beau mais petit.  Les serveuses sont vraiment gentilles et aimables ça aide à compenser le temps d'attente.  Aussi, les prix augmente assez vite, mais pour un brunch c'est vraiment bon.

All the dishes coming out of the kitchen looked amazing. My food was, sorry to say gross. i sent the order back to the kitchen which is a first for me. The second dish was tasteless. A real disappointment for my husband too who politely paid and we left our brunch plates almost full. Maybe the rest of the menu is better...

Delicious for all senses! Our brunch was delicious and the presentation was very cute. We could feel it was made with care. It definitely has a French touch. The staff is very accommodating and nice. Totally recommended!
La babette hot chocolate was "liquid heaven", rich chocolate. Great coffee and good environment to sit, have a coffee, crepe and talk with friends. Very satisfied.
C'est un bel endroit, un petit musée  Les crêpes salées et sucrées sont très bonnes Le chocolat chaud maison est délice Le service est très agréable Une bonne adresse sur st Denis

Cute shop, love the feel of it. The reproductions of 20s era adverts for sale were really tempting.  I tried Le Babette. On my first sip I said "Oh WOW!" Drinking chocolates are something I love, and this one was the best I ever had. It definitely made my chilly walk down St.Denis a lot better. Smooth and sweet without being overly so. It wasn't as spicy as I had expected. I am looking forward to trying more of their 21 flavours.  Looking forward to stopping here once it warms up and enjoying their terrace.
Super endroit! Belle terrasse! Service sympathique! De bons brunchs mais aussi et surtout d excellentes glace de crème mille faite maison : surtout la Natella!!!
Very enjoyable place for brunch. Everything about this place is really nice. The food, presentation, decor and service were all top notch.
Terribly disappointed. Long wait times and mediocre sandwich that took over an hour to make!!

I went here by recommendation of a friend. Though the food was enjoyable, the staff was despondent and absent. When coming here don't expect to be treated well. Come for the food and hot chocolate. But maybe it's best to take it to go.
Wonderful cafe with a happy atmosphere for brunch! Enjoyed the salmon eggs Benedict wth scalloped potatoes and chocolate mouse. Le Belge hot chocolate was life changing!

I think at one point I plead with the owners to come with me immediately to California and they politely declined, thinking I was kidding.   I have found my favorite tea spot (Alice's Tea Cup, NYC), french toast spot (Mother's Bistro, Portland), and gyros spot (Halal Guys gyros plate, NYC). Today , I have found my favorite hot chocolate spot tucked away in the Latin Quarter of Montreal.   I went with the classic Babette hot chocolate from the menu and came close to fainting after the first sip. In fact, I was so overwhelmed by all the happiness going on in my taste bud world, I danced to the counter and in chocolate drunkeness asked the owner to marry me. Ok, no I didn't. But I did say, WHAT IS IN THIS I WANT IT NOW. So I purchased the chocolate chips and spices (special ingredients) to take home with me.   Their hot chocolate is stellar. You need some in your life, even though you don't know it yet.

Sur saint Denis facilement accessible,  si vous ne pouvez pas réserver sur leur site pour le lendemain appelez les ils prendront la réservation pour le lendemain.  Pas grand monde a 10h30 mais à 11h toutes les tables sont prises.  Décoration spartiate qui se veut parisienne mais n y recherchais pas Paris que ce soit dans la découverte ou sur la carte...  Cela dit le restaurant est mignon et les propriétaires précisent sur leur présentation que l endroit est modeste et qu on ne vient pas chez Babette pour sa décoration.   Les brunch sont copieux mais l on regrettera que la bruscheta annoncée soit en fait un croûton microscopique avec deux petits carrés de tomates.  Les plats sont goûteux et le choix est varié vous trouverez forcément votre bonheur sur leur carte  Le thé ou le café est offert dans le menu brunch ce qui est appréciable - surtout quand on constate que le jus de fruit est à 4.50$..  Un bon moment en somme et des brunch copieux et variés.

Le Festin de Babette a attiré votre regard ? Il faut dire que la décoration à elle seule vaut le détour. On se croirait dans un salon de thé parisien, avec de belles couleurs pastels et des décorations vintage. Mais il n'y a pas que le décor à voir ! Le menu est très vaste, surtout pour le brunch, et vous pourrez choisir entre diverses combinaisons, sucrées, salées ou sucrées-salées.  Personnellement, j'ai pris la formule avec du muesli, des pancakes et un uf poché. Un brunch garni, et qui cale bien.  Seul bémol : j'avais commandé un verre de jus d'orange frais et un thé, et toute la table a été servie, sauf moi. Je l'ai indiqué a la serveuse, qui m'a dit s'en occuper, mais a la fin de mon assiette, on ne m'a apporté que mon thé.  Mais je ne leur en veux pas plus que ça, il faut dire que l'endroit était plein : c'est un incontournable du quartier :)
Crepes à la française comme on les aime. Chocolat chaud excellent. Une bonne adresse pour un gouter

Very rustic place. Mismatched furniture, off Knick knacks. Would make a great Instagram photo place. Lots of variety on the menu. I had their brunch. Which comes with eggs, salad, potatoes, soup and dessert. Well worth the price. I was stuffed, actually couldn't finish the potatoes. Friendly service. Would definitely visit again.

Cute space, not big on culinary value.  For the winter's months reduce the # of nice tables in the front room, and replace plastic chair and table in back. Hard to have the cozy designed experience of a French cafe when you are literally sitting on top of each other.
It was better when it was across the street years ago and under former owner. Their terasse is infested with insects.

Grand choix de brunchs, au prix unique de 17,5$, incluant le café. Les assiettes brunchs sont assez copieuses et sont composées de plusieurs éléments, variés, sucrés et salés, avec une mini mousse au chocolat! Les crêpes salées sont bonnes aussi Certains trucs étaient un peu trop gras à mon goût (le gratin, les saucisses) Le décor est super mignon Pour les groupes (8 pers et + je crois), il faut réserver et les résa le WE sont pour 11h max Dans tous les cas, je crois qu'il vaut mieux réserver car nous, le dimanche vers 11h30, c'était plein! A essayer!!

Went here with my boyfriend on a Sunday around 5pm. We ordered a hot chocolate, a crepe with ham, cheese, and mushrooms, and a crepe with caramel.  The hot chocolate was a real hot chocolate, served in a bowl with a spoon.  The ham, cheese and mushroom crepe wasn't that great. I took a few bites but that's it.  The caramel crepe was good. Although all te caramel seemed to be in the middle and not around the edges. It tasted really good though.   Te atmosphere is cute and cozy.

Recently tried out au Festin de Babette as I had read so many good reviews about it and it's on many lists of Top brunch places in the city. The resto itself is small and very vintage located in an old home converted to resto.  The service was friendly but I have to say the food was nothing to write home about. I was disappointed in the food and so were my group of foodie friends. The crepes were nothing special and neither was their drolet dish...egg was overcooked and their potatoe dauphin did not taste great. Their dishes are overpriced for the quality of food.  I had high expecatations going in but it definately was below expectations. There are plenty of other better tasting breakfast places in the city.

Amazing soup and dauphinoise. BUT the wait for the table and the wait for the food were about an hour on the weekend, so be prepared!   Their rose tea is good, but again all rose teas are good for me.  Tip. Avoid seating near the kitchen (it can get quite pretty smokey!).

We wanted a quick, light bite after a morning of walking. This was a perfect place. My friend and I split the tomato basil crepe. They were kind enough to plate it separately. A lovely brief respite during our exploration of the Plateau.

Found this place on Yelp and came in for brunch. A popular spot with a cute interior, nice decor. They seemed to have large brunch meal specialities on a board, but they were written in French and our servers did not speak English. I got a mushroom cheese crepe that was great and we split a sweet king kong crepe for dessert. My boyfriend was disappointed when his egg sandwich came out with hard-boiled egg / egg salad on it. If I returned, I would be adventurous and try one of the sampler meal specials.

Je n'y retournerai pas pour bruncher c'est certain! Nous y sommes allés un jour de beau temps et chaleur. Comme c'était quand même pas mal bruyant à l'intérieur nous avons choisi la terrasse... ils ont les pieds de parasol mais pas les parasols... pas tant agréable vu la chaleur!! Côté repas, le gratin dauphinois par 30deg n'est pas tant rafraîchissant (pas le choix avec les ufs bénédictines) et en plus il était cramé sur le dessus. Les ufs quant à eux étaient tous trop cuits : pas un ne coulaient à la coupe Bref, bien déçue, je n'y reviendrai pas!

L'endroit est parfait pour le brunch. 5 choix seulement, au prix unique de 16,50$. Copieux, beaux et bons! J'ai pris la formule sucrée: ufs, crêpes, baguette, granula, yogourt, confiture. Est inclu le café, ou le thé (English breakfast, oolong, jasmin, ...).  L'endroit est accueillant, chaleureux, et la terrasse est agréable.  À tester l'après-midi pour goûter à leurs multiples chocolats chauds et crêpes bretonnes!

I recommended this place to a friend and was excited to try it together. This was my third time visiting this establishment. Unfortunately we had a poor dining experience, especially in terms of service.  We ordered a Quebecois brunch platter to share for around $17.50. This included a cup of tea/espresso. The caramelized sausages were delicous however the poached eggs were not seasoned. The pancakes were not very good either and I believe our syrup was not maple syrup, which was a disappointment. Their hot chocolate is delicious, especially The Dalmatian, but a little on the pricey side at $5 a cup (but oh so light and frothy).  The service was nothing short of disappointing. If you value service, don't bother coming here. We were meandering around waiting to be assigned a table until I finally asked if we were able to sit anywhere. We then had to ask for our menus as well as place our orders. Ultimately our experience was very lackluster and I will not be returning, no matter how much I love their hot chocolate.

I highly recommend Au Festin de Babette for their brunch. Their selection of brunches is different than most other places. The one I usually go for includes a hot drink, a soup, a gratin dauphinois, two eggs Benedict, and a chocolate mousse. All of the items are excellent, especially the gratin dauphinois. This meal is usually very satisfying and cost less than $20 which is reasonable for good brunches in Montreal. The interior is very cute and feels homie and the service is usually good.

This is a really cool little cafe.  I don't get hot chocolate very often, but we were told by our friend that you have try the hot chocolate so we did and we were impressed.  I don't remember the exact names of the hot chocolates but I know mines was 64% percent dark chocolate and it was definitely a very rich flavored chocolate.  My wife's hot chocolate was a white chocolate with some spices that had a nice little kick at the end.  After drinking my dark chocolate, hers tasted quite sweet to me but she loved it.  I really enjoyed mine as well.  I didn't try the ice cream but it looked like they had about 10-12 flavors to choose from.    This is one of those places that's a nice little find on a very busy street.
Vous recherchez le meilleur chocolat chaud en ville? C'est ici que ça se passe. Faites-moi confiance, ce breuvage divin changera votre vie. Il est riche, crémeux et onctueux. L'extase totale!

Loads of pastries, chocolates, cookies and gelato! This was definitely a find on Rue St. Denis. There are tons of little cafés, shops & restaurants on this being the most popular street of Montreal. Finding this little gem was a great way to end our stay. This cute and oh so comfy café was the perfect place to enjoy the city and by far, serves the best gelato that I've EVER had! (outside of Italy, of course) The gelato was light, creamy and full of flavor. I enjoyed the gelato so much that I could not leave without having seconds! (it was seriously that good) I know, I know, there are tons of similar establishments in Montreal, but I really do believe that you won't be disappointed at Au festin de Babette. Take a seat, enjoy the café, while sipping a cappuccino, after gorging on one of their delectable pastries or gelatos...you'll almost forget you are in Canada, but rather in some café in Europe.

This is such a lovely little cafe! Very quaint and cute atmosphere.  It has a LOT of chocolates to choose from and the hot chocolate is delicious.  I ordered Le Babette and it was amazing!  A wonderful little stop to warm up while shopping along St. Denis.  Remember to bring cash because they have a high minimum to charge on debit/credit.
Excellent Dark Chocolate Gelato! What I would expect from a chocolatier.

Steaming hot chocolate and I mean chocolate, thick and creamy and chocolaty.  If we lived next door we would go every day.  I suspect in the winter snow it tastes even better.   Arguably the best thing we have had today.

This place is a gem. The brunch plates are huge and delicious in every aspect. The potatoes alone keeps me coming back again and again. Everything is extremely hearty and flavourful, perfect for cold winter days. The menu consists of all the classic brunch dishes and more. Feel free to ask the waitresses for recommendations! They are all very friendly :)

I had a origin chocolate which was pretty good and the service was fast and friendly ....  But the salted crepe we had lacked of salt, and overall, taste. Mushrooms on top looked canned and the texture was not great. I can be picky with my crepes so this would explain a lot.   The sweet one, salted caramel was good but they were a bit greedy with the quantity of caramel on top. And well, nothing special.   Not bad, not great.   Kind of a good interior, pretty cute and you can buy products inside too (jams and so on)

Si vous avez envie d'un bon brunch sans pour autant vouloir vous empiffrer de pancakes, testez Au Festin de Babette !   5 ou 6 types de brunch sont proposés et pour ma part j'ai testé l'assiette "le Drolet".  Pour $18, vous avez une belle assiette avec un gratin dauphinois (très bon, avec des pommes de terre finement coupées mais bien fermes), un muffin anglais avec du saumon fumé et deux ufs mollets (coulants à souhait), une petite salade verte bien assaisonnée, le velouté du jour, une mousse au chocolat et un espresso / thé au choix.  Ils proposent aussi des glaces maison qui ont l'air très bonnes. Mais personnellement je n'avais plus de place après mon brunch donc ce sera pour la prochaine fois !

Tout simplement charmant! Dès qu'on y mets les pieds on se sent comme chez soi. Une ambiance retro avec un décor qui va avec. Le menu propose des plats variés et on a le goût de tout prendre. Il y en a pour tout les goûts. La place est assez grand pour tout genre d'occasion, il même une très grande table pour ces réunions à l'improviste. Il y a même une mini boutique avec toutes sortes d'idées cadeaux!

Si vous cherchez un brunch original qui ose sortir des sentiers battus, le Festin de Babette est l'endroit qu'il vous faut! Il n'y a pas beaucoup d'options (5 au total, chacune aux alentours de 16$) mais elles valent le détour. Que vous ayez envie de sucré (Panna cotta aux fruits rouges, verrine du moment qui accompagne quasiment chaque plat, etc.) ou de salé (y compris du gratin dauphinois!), vous trouverez sûrement de quoi vous satisfaire. Plusieurs plats sont également disponibles pour les végétariens et il y a une grande sélection de thés. La terrasse est relativement classique mais, par contre, l'intérieur a un charme authentique et "vintage" indéniable. Jetez un coup d'il aux photos et vous comprendrez. Il y a également assez de place pour accueillir des grands groupes. Seul petit bémol: le restaurant ouvre à 10h la fin de semaine, ce qui est légèrement tard pour un brunch. Je recommande!

5$ pour une toute petite tasse de chocolat chaud, même s'il est fait à l'ancienne, je trouve que c'est un peu-beaucoup, excessif ! Le lieu est sympa, mais il manque cruellement de couleur locale : quand j'y suis allée, il était exclusivement bondé de Français. Les serveuses sont aimables, mais le service n'est vraiment pas ce qu'il y a de plus rapide. Si j'y retourne ? Probablement pas.

Not your average hot cocoa.   I got the Babette, which was an amazing drinking chocolate with cardamom spice overtones. It was luxurious. Intoxicating, even.  The shop is quirky, and was nearly empty on the snowy day we wandered in, but once that chocolate hit my lips I didn't even know which way was up.
Very cosy and original decor. Really enjoyed the brunch offered for a reasonable price. Definitely a must try for a Sunday morning brunch
La pause rétro quand il fait froid dehors! Ce café c est comme un "Go Back in Time" chaleureux, on a l'impression qu une fois la porte passé, on est dans une autre époque dans un petit Paris.
Too expensive for what they had... i had an egg benedict plate called la drolet but it had a weird side soup with a desert that I dont personally like. I dont think i will go back there again....
